examples: The weather in this city is usually mild throughout the year.
Almond-leaved pear has a mild sweetness and a hint of almond taste.
I like the mild spiciness and crisp texture that green pepper adds to my omelettes.
His favorite season is spring, when the weather is mild and the flowers are in full bloom.
I'm not a fan of spicy foods, but I really enjoy the mild flavor of yellow capsicum.
words.defineVi: không nhiều, nghiêm trọng, hoặc mạnh mẽ

examples: Nearly one-half of the country, from the Pacific Coast to the Great Plains and the Upper Midwest, is experiencing moderate to exceptional drought conditions.
He was too moderate.
He’s too moderate.
He was too moderate.
He's too moderate.
words.defineEn: (of a person or ideology) not extreme or radical and considered reasonable by a majority of people
words.defineVi: (của một người hoặc ý thức hệ) không cực đoan hoặc cực đoan và được đa số người dân coi là hợp lý

examples: The severest toil was child's play compared with this.
When the company's financial problems became too severe to overcome, the CEO called in a financial consultant for advice.
The company's prowess in driving a hard bargain has placed severe pressure on suppliers.
Trauma surgeons work tirelessly to save lives, but ultimately they realize there is a remedy for everything except death and must accept that some injuries are simply too severe.
Fibroids can cause severe pain.
words.defineVi: rất xấu, khắc nghiệt, hoặc dữ dội

examples: He always warned his friends to be cautious of women, saying that the female of the species is more deadly than the male and that they should never underestimate a woman's ability to manipulate and deceive.
One bite from this spider is deadly.
Fortunately, these duels are rarely deadly.
Constant exposure could be deadly.
Some nematodes can be deadly.
words.defineEn: causing death or capable of causing death
words.defineVi: gây ra cái chết hoặc có khả năng gây ra cái chết

examples: You may have method to your madness, but these radical changes to the business could still prove catastrophic.
"Fourth place for Joe Biden is catastrophic."
The same region suffered catastrophic wildfires just a year ago.
This crack right here on this part in the landing gear could cause catastrophic failure on the landing gear.
But the effects of the corona virus have been catastrophic.
words.defineEn: causing a great deal of harm, suffering, or damage
words.defineVi: gây ra rất nhiều tác hại, đau khổ hoặc thiệt hại
